item.title: National Aeronautics and Space Administration Authorization Act of 2014

latestAction.text: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation.

item.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to without objection. (text: CR H5390)
Passed/agreed to in House: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to without objection.(text: CR H5390)
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: CR H5390-5391)

summary.text: Directs the Clerk of the House of Representatives to request that the Senate return H.R. 4412 (the National Aeronautics and Space Administration Authorization Act of 2014) to the House.

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Directs the Clerk of the House of Representatives to request that the Senate return H.R. 4412 (the National Aeronautics and Space Administration Authorization Act of 2014) to the House.

bill.title: Directing the Clerk of the House of Representatives to request the Senate to return to the House the bill (H.R. 4412) entitled "An Act to authorize the programs of the National Aeronautics and Space Administration, and for other purposes.".

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
